com.google.enterprise.adaptor.prebuilt

Class DateFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.enterprise.adaptor.prebuilt.DateFilter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MetadataTransform

    public class DateFilter
extends Object
implements MetadataTransform
    Transform causing exclusion of certain Documents, based on a date in that document's Metadata or Param properties. Documents whose associated date is before the configured date will not be indexed.

    Configuration properties:

    key The name of the metadata or param property whose date value determines whether the document will be skipped or not.

    format The DateFormat used to parse the document's date values. If no format is specified, a ISO8601 format ("yyyy-MM-dd") is used. If format is "millis", then the dates are parsed as if they were milliseconds since the epoch (January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT). Otherwise, a lenient SimpleDateFormat with the format pattern will be used.

    date The cut-off for the date value. Documents whose date value is before the configued date will not be indexed. The configured date must be parsable by the configured date format, unless format is "millis", in which case the date must be specified in ISO8601 format. Only one of date or days configuration may be specified.

    days The cut-off for the date value. Documents whose date value is more than days before present will not be indexed. This can be used to have a rolling window of indexed documents. Those whose date have expired will be removed from the index. Only one of date or days configuration may be specified.

    keyset The location of the date value to consider. The keyset may be set to metadata or to params to restrict the search to metadata or params, respectively. If keyset is not specified, it defaults to metadata.

    Example 1: skip documents that have not been accessed for more than 3 years: 

    
 metadata.transform.pipeline=dateFilter
 metadata.transform.pipeline.dateFilter.factoryMethod=com.google.enterprise.adaptor.prebuilt.DateFilter.create
 metadata.transform.pipeline.dateFilter.key=Last_Access_Date
 metadata.transform.pipeline.dateFilter.days=1095

    Example 2: skip pre-Y2K client records that used old-style US date formats: 

    
 metadata.transform.pipeline=dateFilter
 metadata.transform.pipeline.dateFilter.factoryMethod=com.google.enterprise.adaptor.prebuilt.DateFilter.create
 metadata.transform.pipeline.dateFilter.key=Last_Visit_Date
 metadata.transform.pipeline.dateFilter.format=MM/dd/YY
 metadata.transform.pipeline.dateFilter.date=01/01/00

    Example 3: skip documents that have not been modified since 2010: 

    
 metadata.transform.pipeline=dateFilter
 metadata.transform.pipeline.dateFilter.factoryMethod=com.google.enterprise.adaptor.prebuilt.DateFilter.create
 metadata.transform.pipeline.dateFilter.keyset=params
 metadata.transform.pipeline.dateFilter.key=Last-Modified-Millis-UTC
 metadata.transform.pipeline.dateFilter.format=millis
 metadata.transform.pipeline.dateFilter.date=2010-01-01
    Since:
    4.1.4

    • Method Detail

      • transform

        public void transform(Metadata metadata,
                      Map<String,String> params)
        Conditionally adds a Transmission-Decision entry to the params Map. The decision is based on settings of the key, pattern, decideOnMatch, decision, and keyset configuration variables (as discussed above).
        Specified by:
        transform in interface MetadataTransform
        Parameters:
        metadata - of document
        params - are extra contextual information
